sub_title: Controls & Instrumentation Engineer at VBR Turbine Partners; GE Aeroderivative Gas Turbines
summary:
I am an engineer, driven with a goal of accomplishing something new day-by-day in an urge to improve myself and surroundings. I did my master thesis at the Technical University of Eindhoven in Mechanical Department, with a specialization in thermal energy storage, to explore sustainable energy solutions for the currently faced climate-change problems. I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, which provided me ample exposure to a wide range of technical courses and aided me to develop a robust foundation towards application-oriented studies.
I am involved in a couple of voluntary projects, owing to my liking. One of them, being an active CommUnity member and Team Builder at Benelux InnoEnergy CommUnity. I also serves as a facilitator during CommUnity meetings and has managed to successfully organize five CommUnity events in the academic year. I am deeply inspired by traveling, which allowed me to meet people from diverse cultures and traditions. I am always passionate to work on new projects that incorporate multi-cultural teams and knowledge sharing.

projects.title: People-Centered Accelerator to advance gender equality, social inclusion and women’s empowerment in the sustainable energy sector
projects.description:
•	Demonstrate scalable access pathways to achieve access to electrification and clean cooking for the most vulnerable and hardest to reach
•	Empower mid-career women in energy companies to achieve autonomy, authority and decision-making power at work, and thereby accelerate progress on international climate change goals
•	Contributed to SEforALL’s report released at COP23 for mapping out the global landscape of women support and marginalized group in sustainable energy

projects.title: Master Thesis: Kinetic investigation of the K2CO3 composite at reactor scale to analyze its hydration/dehydration performance.
projects.description:
- Expertise in operating the reactor setup machine independently.
- Recommended design modifications to eliminate machine malfunctions.
- Conducted research to test the materials performance on the reactor scale.
- Performed analytical and engineering calculations and strengthened proficiency in working with large data sets.
- Involved in data analytics and Matlab® skills to extract performance indicators relevant to material performance.

projects.title: Smart Integrated Do It Yourself (DIY) Kits for Home Retrofits
projects.description: Worked on a project aimed at developing DIY retrofit kits, that enable customers to improve their homes for enhanced comfort and lower climate impact by providing DIY packages for housing retrofit directly to tenants and homeowners

contributors.headline: Controls & Instrumentation Engineer at VBR Turbine Partners; GE Aeroderivative Gas Turbines

projects.title: Design of a Concentrated Solar Power-plant with Thermal Energy Storage in Boujdour, Morocco
projects.description:
•	The feasibility of a CSP power plant with 80 MW firm rated power output at the designated site, Boujdour, Morocco was found out.
•	To assure the operation of the field consistently meets the tariff scheme from 05:00 to 22:00 throughout the year, the solar field is designed to function under the worst case scenario of the sunlight hour on 21st December with 10-hour storage capacity. 
•	The power plant is expected to produce 492.2 GWh electricity with the price of 0.2 € per kWh. It takes 10 years to reach the payback time of the investment return

contributors.headline: Controls & Instrumentation Engineer at VBR Turbine Partners; GE Aeroderivative Gas Turbines

projects.title: EIT InnoEnergy Master´s Project of the Year (2016-present): "The Honde Valley, Zimbabwe Challenge”
projects.description:
EIT InnoEnergy Masters Project of the Year (2016-2017): "The Honde Valley, Zimbabwe Challenge”
•	Aimed to analyse pathways for Sustainable Business Development in the Honde Valley in Zimbabwe
•	Addressed issues include possible sources of income for the rural community, existing sustainable and cheap energy solutions of the Valley, creating employment opportunities for the vulnerable youth, sanitation solutions and making the Honde Valley a Good Village model
•	Travelled Zimbabwe in March 2017 and developed a sustainable business model of the abandoned warehouse in the Honde Valley for providing services such as lantern charging & renting, mobile charging, IT-services and TV shows

contributors.headline: Controls & Instrumentation Engineer at VBR Turbine Partners; GE Aeroderivative Gas Turbines

projects.title: Analysing Business opportunity of innovative Magnetic Induction Generator Bicycle
projects.description: During my Master´s programme, a project of “Technological Entrepreneurship” familiarized me with the potential of transforming ideas into business plans and successfully diffusing the product to the targeted customer market. With the team of different educational backgrounds, I worked in group for one semester with the aim to analyse the product and its business opportunity. The group performed market analysis, minimum product viability, value chain, customer segmentation, sales process and eventually developed Business model canvas.

contributors.headline: Controls & Instrumentation Engineer at VBR Turbine Partners; GE Aeroderivative Gas Turbines

projects.title: Demand Response in Denmark (Energy Auditing and Economic Analysis)
projects.description: Demand response (DR) refers to the change in electrical power consumption by a consumer based on ever-changing electricity price. Due to the high cost of electricity storage, capacity for its storage is very small compared to the amount of electricity produced. Therefore, electricity production rate has to match consumption rate at all times. Demand response energy auditing part was done by listing the consumer segments of Denmark by their suitability to DR. For economic analysis, estimation of economically feasible flexible demand was found out along with the savings and electricity consumption needed to justify the cost of implementing DR in Denmark.

contributors.headline: Controls & Instrumentation Engineer at VBR Turbine Partners; GE Aeroderivative Gas Turbines

projects.title: Potential of Wind Power in Taiwan considering natural and grid limitations
projects.description: This project was focused on the potential of wind power in Taiwan. The energy profile of Taiwan, current power grid profile and new government policies such as “Nuclear Free Homeland” were discussed together with green energy policy. The grid limitation, available backup power and possible storage capacities to deal with the intermittency of renewables were found out.

contributors.headline: Controls & Instrumentation Engineer at VBR Turbine Partners; GE Aeroderivative Gas Turbines

projects.title: Performance Investigation of Maisotsenko- Cycle (M-Cycle) using Different Configurations of Heat & Mass Exchanger
projects.description:
Bachelor Thesis Project: Performance Investigation of Maisotsenko- Cycle (M-Cycle) using Different Configurations of Heat & Mass Exchange
•	Performed theoretical, experimental and computer based analysis of the dew point indirect evaporative cooler based on M-cycle
•	Fabricated a counter-flow HMX configuration with design optimization, material selection, numerical simulation, experimental analysis and its comparison with cross-flow heat and mass exchanger
•	Obtained results that showed counter-flow exchanger offered greater (around 20% higher) cooling capacity, greater (15%-23% higher) dew-point and wet-bulb effectiveness when compared against cross-flow configuration with equal physical size and under the identical functional surroundings

contributors.headline: Controls & Instrumentation Engineer at VBR Turbine Partners; GE Aeroderivative Gas Turbines

projects.title: Design, Fabrication and Calculation of Solar based Cooker
projects.description: During my undergraduate degree while studying the course of Renewable energy technology, I designed and fabricated solar oven that utilizes solar energy from the sun to heat and cook food, and is beneficial particularly in equatorial regions where solar energy is abundant. This box-type solar oven has the capability of cooking food from direct solar rays without any concentration. I performed the experiment and calculated its cooking capacity, efficiency, effectiveness, cooking temperature and time.

contributors.headline: Controls & Instrumentation Engineer at VBR Turbine Partners; GE Aeroderivative Gas Turbines

projects.title: Structural analysis of a mechanical component in ANSYS 14.0
projects.description: Performed an static structural analysis of a mechanical component by evaluating its total deformation, von-misses stresses, and maximum principal stresses. The 3D model of the mechanical component was developed on Pro-E Wildfire 5.0.

company.name: ENERGIA International Network on Gender and Sustainable Energy

profile_positions.company: ENERGIA - International Network on Gender and Sustainable Energy
profile_positions.description:
EIT InnoEnergy SELECT Masters| Integrated Project of the Year (2017-2018): Women's Empowerment: Opportunities and Challenges in the Sustainable Energy Sector
•	Task: Building the evidence base for women's empowerment and entrepreneurship to improve energy interventions' effectiveness. 
        -     Supported by Dr. Anita Shankar -Public health researcher with Johns Hopkins University (Baltimore, US) and Dr. Amanda Elam -Research Director of 'The Center for Women’s Entrepreneurial Leadership' (CWEL) at Babson College (Massachusetts, US).
•	Responsibility: To conduct interviews with local entrepreneurs of Uganda and Kenya to determine whether access to energy-related products enhance women's economic empowerment!
 •	Milestone: The team visited Uganda and Kenya and managed to conduct approximately 170 interviews from local entrepreneurs in three weeks field trip.
profile_positions.title: Student Project

profile_positions.description:
EIT InnoEnergy SELECT Masters| Integrated Project of the Year (2017-2018): Women's Empowerment: Opportunities and Challenges in the Sustainable Energy Sector
•	Aim: The project aims to advance gender equality, social inclusion and women empowerment in the sustainable energy sector. 
•	Task: Identification of policies and approaches empowering women in the sustainable energy sector both from governments and business perspective.
•	Responsibility:
        -     Web-based research of top-ranked companies in the renewable energy sector to identify the companies' policies of women empowerment, the percentage of women employees and parental leave time.
       -     Interviewed companies such as Schneider Electric to understand their ambitions of gender diversity, maternity leave policy and their women empowerment programs.
•	Milestones: 
       -      During the COP23 November 2017 in Bonn, SEforALL launched a new People-Centred Accelerator. Our team has contributed to that research and writing a report "Opening Doors". We are glad to be acknowledged by SEforALL's report released in COP23.
      -       The team is contributing with SEforALL in writing a working paper on women's empowerment, which provides a landscape of governmental and business policies in the sustainable energy sector.

volunteer_experiences.description:
•	Participated in “InnoEnergy Start-Up Days”, a 3 day intensive business model development competition and pitching of business idea
•	Worked on the business idea of SurFarm with the aim to provide different kind of tourism and a place where people can experience a deep change in self and society

•	The CommUnity is a group of passionate InnoEnergy students, alumni, professionals, and entrepreneurs. 
•	Responsibility: To organize events and manage the whole process from the planning stage till its implementation and sometimes post-event evaluation as well. 
        -    Facilitating and making the agenda for the CommUnity meeting sessions, where we discuss the progress of upcoming CommUnity events.
•	Milestone: Successfully organized events such as a workshop on 'Thesis to Startup' and 'Soft skills Development & Event Management', 'Field visit to Smurfit Kappa', and organized the participant's logistics for attending 'Eurelectric Conference' in Brussels.

1) Smurfit Kappa Paper Mill, Roermond, Netherlands
Field Trip: The company is one of the world leaders in paper-based packaging, operates in 21 countries in Europe and up to 10 in North and South America. As their motto “Sustainability in every fiber” suggests, Smurfit Kappa is always exploring new ways to make the production chain more efficient, promoting the circular economy scheme and reducing waste and emissions in an industrial process that consumes a lot of energy.

2) EURELECTRIC Conference, Brussels
Conference on "The Value of Storage for the Clean Energy Transition" held on December 7, 2017, in Brussels, Belgium organized by the EURELECTRIC.

3) Workshop| Thesis to Startup
The main objective of this event was to encourage young minds to enter the startup industry with their ideas originated from their theses. [November 21, 2017].
